verses.verse: Then Elisha<WH477> said<WH559>, Hear<WH8085> you the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>; Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, To morrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> shall a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> be sold for a shekel<WH8255>, and two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, in the gate<WH8179> of Samaria<WH8111>.

Then a lord<WH7991> on whose hand<WH3027> the king<WH4428> leaned<WH8172> answered<WH6030> the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and said<WH559>, Behold<WH3068>, if the Lord would make<WH6213> windows<WH699> in heaven<WH8064>, might this thing<WH1697> be<WH559>? And he said, Behold<WH7200>, you shall see it with your eyes<WH5869>, but shall not eat there<WH398>.
And there were four<WH702> leprous<WH6879> men<WH582> at the entering in<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179>: and they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, Why sit<WH3427> we here until we die<WH4191>?

If we say<WH559>, We will enter<WH935> into the city<WH5892>, then the famine<WH7458> is in the city<WH5892>, and we shall die<WH4191> there<WH3427>: and if we sit still here<WH4191>, we die also<WH3212>. Now therefore come, and let us fall<WH5307> unto the army<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>: if they save us alive<WH2421>, we shall live<WH2421>; and if they kill<WH4191> us<WH4191>, we shall but die.

And they rose up<WH6965> in the twilight<WH5399>, to go<WH935> unto the camp<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>: and when they were come<WH935> to the outermost part<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264> of Syria<WH758>, behold<WH376>, there was no man there.

For the Lord<WH136> had made the army<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758> to hear<WH8085> a noise<WH6963> of chariots<WH7393>, and a noise<WH6963> of horses<WH5483>, even the noise<WH6963> of a great<WH1419> army<WH2428>: and they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, Behold<WH4428>, the king of Israel<WH3478> has hired<WH7936> against us the kings<WH4428> of the Hittites<WH2850>, and the kings<WH4428> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, to come upon us<WH935>.

Therefore they arose<WH6965> and fled<WH5127> in the twilight<WH5399>, and left<WH5800> their tents<WH168>, and their horses<WH5483>, and their donkeys<WH2543>, even the camp<WH4264> as it was<WH5127>, and fled for their life<WH5315>.

And when these lepers<WH6879> came<WH935> to the outermost part<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264>, they went<WH935> into one<WH259> tent<WH168>, and did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and carried<WH5375> there silver<WH3701>, and gold<WH2091>, and clothes<WH899>, and went<WH3212> and hid<WH2934> it<WH7725>; and came again, and entered<WH935> into another<WH312> tent<WH168>, and carried<WH5375> there also<WH3212>, and went and hid it<WH2934>.

Then they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, We do<WH6213> not well<WH3117>: this day is a day<WH3117> of good news<WH1309>, and we hold our peace<WH2814>: if we stay<WH2442> until the morning<WH1242> light<WH216>, some mischief<WH5771> will come<WH4672> upon us<WH3212>: now therefore come, that we may go<WH935> and tell<WH5046> the king<WH4428>'s household<WH1004>.

So they came<WH935> and called<WH7121> unto the porter<WH7778> of the city<WH5892>: and they told<WH5046> them<WH559>, saying, We came<WH935> to the camp<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>, and<WH376>, behold, there was no man there<WH6963>, neither voice of man<WH120>, but horses<WH5483> tied<WH631>, and donkeys<WH2543> tied<WH631>, and the tents as they were<WH168>.
And he called<WH7121> the porters<WH7778>; and they told<WH5046> it to the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004> inside<WH6441>.

And the king<WH4428> arose<WH6965> in the night<WH3915>, and said<WH559> unto his servants<WH5650>, I will now show<WH5046> you what the Syrians<WH758> have done<WH6213> to us<WH3045>. They know that we are hungry<WH7457>; therefore are they gone out<WH3318> of the camp<WH4264> to hide<WH2247> themselves in the field<WH7704>, saying<WH559>, When they come out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892>, we shall catch<WH8610> them alive<WH2416>, and get<WH935> into the city<WH5892>.

And one<WH259> of his servants<WH5650> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Let some take<WH3947>, I pray you<WH2568>, five of the horses<WH5483> that remain<WH7604>, which are left<WH7604> in the city<WH1995>, (behold, they are as all the multitude of Israel<WH3478> that are left<WH7604> in it<WH1995>: behold, I say, they are even as all the multitude of the Israelites<WH3478> that are consumed<WH8552>:) and let us send<WH7971> and see<WH7200>.

They took<WH3947> therefore two<WH8147> chariot<WH7393> horses<WH5483>; and the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971> after<WH310> the army<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>, saying<WH559>, Go<WH3212> and see<WH7200>.

And they went<WH3212> after<WH310> them unto Jordan<WH3383>: and<WH1870>, behold, all the way was full<WH4392> of garments<WH899> and vessels<WH3627>, which the Syrians<WH758> had cast away<WH7993> in their haste<WH2648>. And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725>, and told<WH5046> the king<WH4428>.

And the people<WH5971> went out<WH3318>, and spoiled<WH962> the tents<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>. So a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> was sold for a shekel<WH8255>, and two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, according to the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>.

And the king<WH4428> appointed<WH6485> the lord<WH7991> on whose hand<WH3027> he leaned<WH8172> to have the charge of the gate<WH8179>: and the people<WH5971> trod<WH7429> upon him in the gate<WH8179>, and he died<WH4191>, as the man<WH376> of God<WH430> had said<WH1696>, who spoke<WH1696> when the king<WH4428> came down to him<WH3381>.

And it came to pass as the man<WH376> of God<WH430> had spoken<WH1696> to the king<WH4428>, saying<WH559>, Two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, and a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> for a shekel<WH8255>, shall be to morrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> in the gate<WH8179> of Samaria<WH8111>:

And that lord<WH7991> answered<WH6030> the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and said<WH559>, Now<WH3068>, behold, if the Lord should make<WH6213> windows<WH699> in heaven<WH8064>, might such a thing<WH1697> be<WH559>? And he said, Behold<WH7200>, you shall see it with your eyes<WH5869>, but shall not eat there<WH398>.
And so it fell out unto him<WH5971>: for the people trod<WH7429> upon him in the gate<WH8179>, and he died<WH4191>.
